gov.nasa.worldwind.examples.util
Class ShapefileLoader

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.worldwind.examples.util.ShapefileLoader

public class ShapefileLoader
extends Object

Converts Shapefile geometry into World Wind renderable objects. Shapefile geometries are mapped to World Wind objects as follows:

Shapefile GeometryWorld Wind Object
PointWWIcon
MultiPointList of WWIcon
PolylineSurfacePolylines
PolygonSurfacePolygons

Shapefiles do not contain a standard definition for color and other visual attributes. Though some Shapefiles contain color information in each record's key-value attributes, ShapefileLoader does not attempt to interpret that information. Instead, the World Wind renderable objects created by ShapefileLoader are assigned a random color. Callers can replace or extend this behavior by defining a subclass of ShapefileLoader and overriding the following methods:

  • createPointIconSource(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.ShapefileRecord)
  • createPolylineAttributes(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.ShapefileRecord)
  • createPolygonAttributes(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.ShapefileRecord)
.

addRenderablesForPolygons

protected void addRenderablesForPolygons(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.Shapefile shp,
                                         List<Layer> layers)
Creates renderables for all the polygons in the shapefile. Polygon is the only shape that potentially returns a more than one layer, which it does when the polygons per layer limit is exceeded.

Parameters:
shp - the shapefile to read
layers - a list in which to place the layers created. May not be null.

addRenderablesForPolylines

protected void addRenderablesForPolylines(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.Shapefile shp,
                                          RenderableLayer layer)

createLayerFromShapefile

public Layer createLayerFromShapefile(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.Shapefile shp)
Creates a Layer from a general Shapefile.

Parameters:
shp - the Shapefile to create a layer for.
Returns:
a Layer that renders the Shapefile's contents on the surface of the Globe.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the Shapefile is null, or if the Shapefile's primitive type is unrecognized.

createLayerFromSource

public Layer createLayerFromSource(Object source)
Creates a Layer from a general Shapefile source. The source type may be one of the following:
  • InputStream
  • URL
  • File
  • String containing a valid URL description or a file or resource name available on the classpath.

Parameters:
source - the source of the Shapefile.
Returns:
a Layer that renders the Shapefile's contents on the surface of the Globe.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the source is null or an empty string, or if the Shapefile's primitive type is unrecognized.

createLayersFromShapefile

public List<Layer> createLayersFromShapefile(gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.shapefile.Shapefile shp)
Creates a list of Layers containing shapes from a Shapefile.

For polygon shapes, the maximum number of polygons to add to a layer can be specified. By default it's 5000. If there are more polygons in the shapefile than the maximum, new layers are created as needed, with each holding no more than the maximum. All but the first layer is disabled to avoid bogging down the display trying to render an excessive number of shapes. The application can enable the layers selectively to maintain performance.

Parameters:
shp - the source of the Shapefile.
Returns:
a Layer that renders the Shapefile's contents on the surface of the Globe.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the shapefile is null or an empty string, or if the Shapefile's primitive type is unrecognized.

createLayersFromSource

public List<Layer> createLayersFromSource(Object source)
Creates a list of Layers containing shapes from a Shapefile.

For polygon shapes, the maximum number of polygons to add to a layer can be specified. By default it's 5000. If there are more polygons in the shapefile than the maximum, new layers are created as needed, with each holding no more than the maximum. All but the first layer is disabled to avoid bogging down the display trying to render an excessive number of shapes. The application can enable the layers selectively to maintain performance.

The source type may be one of the following:

  • InputStream
  • URL
  • File
  • String containing a valid URL description or a file or resource name available on the classpath.

Parameters:
source - the source of the Shapefile.
Returns:
a Layer that renders the Shapefile's contents on the surface of the Globe.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the source is null or an empty string, or if the Shapefile's primitive type is unrecognized.

Get the height of a record.

Parameters:

Returns:
the height of the shape, or null if there is no height.

getNumPolygonsPerLayer

public int getNumPolygonsPerLayer()
Indicates the maximum number of polygon renderables to place in a single layer. If this limit is exceeded an additional layer is added.

Returns:
the maximum number of polygons to place in a layer.

setNumPolygonsPerLayer

public void setNumPolygonsPerLayer(int numPolygonsPerLayer)
Specifies the maximum number of polygon renderables to place in a single layer. If this limit is exceeded an additional layer is added.

Parameters:
numPolygonsPerLayer - the maximum number of polygons to place in a layer.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the number is less than 1.
